trend_summary: Across the time-series, the landscape stays largely rural: mixed farmland and forest dominate, with only small expansions of villages and farmsteads. Some fields are merged for larger cultivation, while marginal plots in the north and east regenerate to woodland. Infrastructure and road layout remain almost unchanged, reflecting persistently sparse settlement.
notable_changes: Minor enlargement of village clusters along the main western road
New scattered farm buildings and storage barns appear in central tracts
Abandonment of marginal cropland leading to forest regrowth on northern slopes
Hedgerow removal consolidates fields, especially in the southeast quadrant
Road network and major infrastructure show negligible alteration over time
